intro: Corybas shanlinshiensis f. hsinchui, commonly known as the Hsinchui ghost orchid, is a rare and endemic species native to Taiwan. It belongs to the兰科 (Orchidaceae) family and is characterized by its unique, hooded flower structure. The plant produces small, dark purple or black flowers that are typically hidden beneath its leafy bracts. It thrives in shaded, humid environments, often found in forest understories. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a conservation concern.
